textos_fuente.text: Utility Customer Service | Casselberry, FL - Official Site Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In Search Government Services Community Business How Do I Home Government Departments Finance Utility Customer Service Utility Customer Service ANNOUNCEMENT We are currently experiencing a high volume of calls. We appreciate your patience. If you prefer, you can email us at customerservice@casselberry.org . Dear Customers, The City of Casselberry is excited to announce we have launched a new bill pay service! Our new platform features a user-friendly portal and more features to view and pay bills online. You will be able to schedule payments, set it and forget it with AutoPay and more. It’s simple, safe, and secure! Please Note: If you previously used your credit card to set up an autopay, you will need to re-register your account and re-enroll to establish AutoPay in the new system. Also, your account number must be entered in a specific format when searching for your utility account. There must be 6 digits before the dash and 6 digits after. If your account number is not long enough you can fill the gap using zeroes. For example, if your account number is 123-4567 it will need to be entered as 000123-004567. For your convenience, the following guide has been created that walks you through how to pay a bill and enroll in autopay! Please click here for instructions on how to pay a bill and enroll in autopay. Please click here for instructions on how to manage your autopay. Please click here to access your payment portal. With our new platform, you can: Pay your utility bills anytime 24/7 via an easy-to-use online portal AutoPay – save time and avoid late or missed payments Pay by Text to get text notifications about your bill and pay by text if you’re on the go Pay over the phone using a landline or mobile device using our 24/7 automated Pay by Phone feature If you have any questions, please contact us at customerservice@casselberry.org or (407) 262-7760 option 2. Overview Utility Customer Service is responsible for providing prompt and courteous customer service by telephone, online, or in person to all City of Casselberry water utility customers and potential customers. This is accomplished by the following: Answer billing questions and resolve billing issues Start and terminate utility accounts upon request Monitor consumption for each customer and advise customers if there is a possible leak situation Resolve customer issues by producing field service orders to repair and maintain water meters and meter boxes when necessary Water Main Breaks and Other Emergencies During business hours For a water main break or sewer backup that occurs during business hours of Monday through Thursday 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. (excluding holidays), contact Public Works at (407) 262-7725 . After business hours and weekends For a water main break or sewer backup that occurs after business hours, call the Emergency Line at (407) 262-7613 . Starting Service If you are new to our City and need to begin service, you can visit us in person or complete the online application. Click the following link to view requirements for starting service: Opening a New Utility Account . Below are links for the online applications for service. Application for Residential or Commercial Property Utility Services Irrigation Meter Application If same day services are needed , all documents and completed application must be submitted before 12:00 p.m. (noon) Monday through Thursday.  If an application is submitted after 12:00 p.m., it will be processed the next business day. Stopping Service Termination of water service, including sewer, irrigation, and reclaimed water, requires a minimum of one (1) business day advance notice.  Utility services are terminated Monday through Thursday, excluding holidays. Ending service can be requested in person at City Hall or by completing the application in the link below. Application for Termination of Water Service Billing Adjustments Customers of the City of Casselberry may request an adjustment on the current water bill if they have recently encountered a leak, pool fill, or unexplained/unintended usage by completing and submitting the application in the link below or by visiting us at City Hall. Utility Adjustment Request Form As a customer of City of Casselberry Utilities Division, you may request an adjustment on your current water bill if you have recently encountered double the usage of consumption due to a leak, pool fill or new sod in a 12-month period or unexplained/unintended usage once in a 3-year period. The adjustment request must be submitted within 45 days of repair and 30 days from bill date for unexplained/unintended use. Valid proof of repair must be included. The submittal of this request does not prevent your account from collection activity, including service interruption. Please refer to the adjustment ordinance 18-1499 and/or adjustment policy for full details. Payment Plan If a payment plan is desired, the account holder must speak with a Utility Customer Service Representative by visiting the Customer Service desk at City Hall or by calling (407) 262-7760. Payment Methods Select a payment method listed below to see additional information. Cash Credit Card Check or Money Order Cash Cash is accepted in person only. Credit Card Payment by credit card The City accepts payment by Visa, MasterCard, American Express, or Discover.  Payment can be made in person, by phone, and using the Online Payment System.  Visit the How Do I section to pay by credit card or click here . Note that you will need your account number in order to access your account online. Your account number can be found on the top of the monthly invoice, by calling 407-262-7760 during business hours, or by sending an email to CustomerService@casselberry.org Check or Money Order Pay by check or money order using one of the methods listed below: Bank Draft Never miss a payment! Sign up to have your monthly utility invoice paid automatically by bank draft from a bank or credit union account. To sign up for Bank Draft, complete and submit the Bank Draft Authorization form . Mail Mail check or money order along with the payment stub and/or account number to: P.O. Box 180819 Casselberry, FL  32718-0819 In Person Casselberry City Hall 95 Triplet Lake Drive Casselberry, FL  32707 Monday through Thursday, 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Payment Drop Box The 24 hour payment drop box is located at the exit of the visitor's parking lot for City Hall Payments are collected from the box Monday through Thursday at 8:00 a.m., excluding holidays. Only payments made by check or money order are permitted in the Payment Drop Box. Contact Us Email CustomerService@casselberry.org Physical Address 95 Triplet Lake Drive Casselberry , FL 32707 Phone: (407) 262-7760 Option 2 Fax: (407) 262-7762 Emergency Phone: (407) 262-7613 Hours Monday through Thursday 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Closed Friday through Sunday. Directory FAQs My water bill is much higher than normal. What do I do? What are the current watering restrictions? Who We Are Afro Latin JAzz CALENDAR Artists WATCH & LISTEN BelongÃ³ Who we are About Us Our Team Our Board Our Supporters What We do About Belongo Present &Â Produce Educate &Â Inspire Protect &Â Advance Who We Are What We Do CASA BELONGÃ Support us Shop Donate Arturo O'Farrill The Afro Latin Jazz Orchestra & Ensemble The Fat Cats collaborations About Us our team our board our supporters About BelongÃ³ Present & Produce Educate & Inspire Protect & Advance Donate who we are We activate the power of music and the arts to create a space for creativity and understanding that strengthens bonds and enriches lives across the communities we serve. Our Mission BelongÃ³ is dedicated to performing, educating about, and preserving the music of all of the Americas, emanating from African and indigenous roots, through the entry point of jazz. BelongÃ³ embraces its mission with a commitment to social justice, equity, inclusion, and the equality of all cultures worldwide. BelongÃ³'s mission is reflected by its core values of cultural inclusiveness, ground-breaking creativity, social consciousness, excellence, and responsible stewardship, and purposeful engagement. our journey Our Origins From 2002 to 2007 Arturo OâFarrill & The Afro Latin Jazz Orchestra were resident artists at Jazz at Lincoln Center where they performed an extensive schedule in New York and across the country while on tour. In 2005, the orchestra recorded its first GRAMMY-nominated album, Una Noche Inolvidable. Our Founding Principles In 2007, Arturo OâFarrill founded the Afro Latin Jazz Alliance (ALJA), a non-profit organization dedicated to expanding awareness of the genre by performing, educating about and preserving the music emanating from African and indigenous roots through the entry point of jazz. All About Education In 2009, the Afro Latin Jazz Academy of Music (ALJAM) was founded to offer music instruction to schools and other sites with music programs. Shortly after, Arturo OâFarrill founded The Fat Afro Latin Jazz Cats Youth Orchestra Program, bringing musical training to the next generation of aspiring musicians. Music For New York & Beyond By 2020, ALJA had provided institutional support to the Afro Latin Jazz Orchestra and developed programs across all five boroughs, including those for the cityâs children. We have also produced concerts and performances in the New York area, across the country, and around the world. Taking it Online In 2020 we established the ALJA Digital Village, an online series created to raise awareness for the music genre through performance and education. In 2020, in response to the pandemic, we launched Virtual Birdland, a weekly, free online event with our musicians playing from diverse locations. An Organization On The Move As of our 15th year anniversary in 2022, our musicians had performed over 870+ performances and reached an audience of over 1M viewers; we had provided music lessons to over 20,000 + K-12 students and are currently present at 21 NYC school districts; We have an archive library of over 750 scores spanning over 16+ genres along with a significant collection of music related memorabilia. In 2023, Arturo and the orchestra received their 7th GRAMMYÂ® award for Best Latin Jazz album. A Bright Future Ahead To build upon this momentum, we are embarking on our next phase of growth to lead the artistic, educational and community nexus that celebrates Latin music, arts & cultures. This mission will transform our organization and allow us to expand our reach and impact by making our education, presentation and preservation activities available to an ever-expanding group of stakeholders. Our Rallying Cry To mark this transformation moment in our journey, we are focused on building awareness of Afro Latin Jazz and changing our organizationâs name to BelongÃ³, our rallying cry to break down barriers and reaffirm our commitment to cultural diversity, equity, inclusion fueled by creativity, excellence, and purposeful engagement. our team Arturo O'Farrill Founder & Artistic Director Marietta Ulacia Executive Director Stefan Andemicael Director of Operations & Administration Andrea Thompson Director of Development Andrew Andron Director of Artistic Planning Jamie Ehrenfeld Director of Education Alberto Miranda Production and Tour Manager Thalia Bloom Manager of Education Programs Isabel Rolston Manager of Institutional Giving Eduardo Almonte Marketing & Communications Manager Jackie Jorgenson Social Media and Content Manager Alexandria Arroyo Executive Assistant & Board Liaison Kevin Gay Data Management our Consultants Zack OâFarrill Youth Orchestra Leader Youth Orchestra Leader Fred Miller Arturo O'Farrill Artist Management Arturo O'Farrill Artist Management Diane Thompson Corporate Relations Corporate Relations Felipe TristÃ¡n Classical & Creative Partnerships Classical & Creative Partnerships Mike Perez Data Management Data Management Sergio Matos Graphic Designer Graphic Designer Unlimited Myles Booking Agent Booking Agent Our board Eduardo Castell Chairman Managing Director The MirRam Group Ramki Muthukrishnan Treasurer Head, U.S. Leveraged Finance S&P Global Ratings Marc Landis Secretary Managing Partner Phillips Nizer, L.L.P. Wacht Member Managing Principal Lee & Associates NYC Andrew Wallach Member Former Co-CEO SpringOwl Asset Management We are grateful to all our donors, sponsors and volunteers for their ongoing support! The DC Jazz Festival®, a 501(c)(3) non-profit service organization, and its programs are made possible, in part, with major grants from the Government of the District of Columbia, Muriel Bowser, Mayor; DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities; National Capital Arts and Cultural Affairs program of the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts; DC Office of Cable Television, Film, Music & Entertainment, the Office of the Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development; and with awards from Mellon Foundation, Doris Duke Charitable Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, Gillon Family Charitable Fund, Bloomberg Philanthropies, Galena-Yorktown Foundation, Morris and Gwendolyn Cafritz Foundation, Leonard and Elaine Silverstein Family Foundation, Henry J. Board - The New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival and Foundation, Inc. Class Got Brass Gallery Exhibits Events Get Involved Donations Jazz & Heritage Circle Sponsorship Opportunities Volunteer & Internship Opportunities Career Opportunities Donate Menu Jazz & Heritage Foundation Board Board Officers Rachel F. Cousin, President Rachel Ferrouillet Cousin retired from the U.S. Postal Service in 2013 after 35 years of employment. Of her 35 years, she spent 32 years in various management positions, with 27 years in the Sales and Marketing arenas. Since retiring, she has become a home-based travel agent and enjoys finding the perfect vacation for her clients. She fills her time traveling, spending time with family and friends and community volunteering. She presently serves on the boards of the Boy Scouts Diversity Gala and Eldercare Services. She has volunteered with the Jazz & Heritage Foundation since 2008. A New Orleans native, Rachel attended St. Joseph Academy and Dominican College. She is married to Alan Cousin, with whom she shares four children and two grandchildren. Sidney H. Cates IV, First Vice President Judge Sidney H. Cates, IV has served as judge of Civil District Court, Division C, since September 2004. He was chosen by his colleagues to be Chief Judge of Orleans Parish Civil District Court for a two year term from January 2016 through December 2018. Prior to his election, Judge Cates was a litigator for twenty-eight years, earning national recognition for his success as a trial and appellate advocate, particularly in products liability and statutory employment litigation. He has served and continues to serve on various community and educational boards. Judge Cates has been a member of the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Foundation Board of Directors since 2015. He has also been a WWOZ Board of Directors member since 2016. Judge Cates is an honors graduate of St. Augustine High School, Loyola University, and Loyola University Law School in New Orleans and has been a member of the Louisiana State Bar since 1976. J Pegues, Second Vice President J Pegues recently retired as Managing Director of Huron Consulting Group, capping over 35 years’ experience specializing in strategy formulation and execution, strategic marketing and sales, and new business development.  J’s experience includes growing businesses in new markets and leading strategic turnarounds.  He is expert at setting a clear vision for organizations, building consensus among leadership, and securing commitment to pursuit of that vision.  Prior to joining Huron, Mr. Pegues held senior leadership roles with LSU, Aetna, CIGNA, Humana, and Coventry Health Care.  J earned his Masters in Business Administration from Tulane University, where the faculty awarded him “The Outstanding Graduate” honor.  He joined the Jazz & Heritage Advisory Council in 2014 and was elected to the Jazz & Heritage Board of Directors in 2017.  He also serves on WWOZ’s Board of Directors, which he chaired from 2019 until 2021. Ellen M. Lee, Secretary/Treasurer Ellen M. Lee is retired from service with the City of New Orleans as the Director of the Office of Community and Economic Development, leading a portfolio of departments developing and implementing equitable programming and policy solutions for New Orleanians at the intersection of business, talent, housing, and arts and culture. Following Hurricane Katrina, Ms. Lee served nearly six years as Senior Vice President of Programs at the Greater New Orleans Foundation where she was responsible for the programmatic and grantmaking activity of the community foundation serving New Orleans and its 12 surrounding parishes. Ms. Lee takes her vast professional experience to her role as President of EML Enterprises, LLC, working with clients to identify, coordinate, and support multi-sector initiatives that strengthen communities and the people who live there. Ms. Lee is twice a graduate of the University of New Orleans holding B.S. in Finance and MBA degrees.  She has served on and held leadership roles on multiple boards of directors of national and local civic and service-related non-profit organizations including the Center for Community Progress, Louisiana Housing Corporation, UNO Foundation, Urban League of Greater New Orleans, Catholic Community Foundation, and since 2017, New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Foundation. CANCELLED: Art & Jazz on the Avenue | Downtown Delray Beach Skip to main content Join us on Business Login Find Your Fun Stay Things to Do Dine Shop Happy Hour Getting Around Events About Us Search a listing Categories Stay Arts & Culture -- Art Galleries, Studios & Antiques -- Museums & Nature Centers -- Theaters & Performing Arts Beauty and Wellness -- Beauty & Spa -- Fitness -- Health & Wellness ---- Chiropractors ---- Counseling ---- Cosmetic/plastic surgeons ---- Dentists ---- Medical massage therapy ---- Optometrists ---- Other therapies ---- Periodontist ---- Podiatrist Entertainment Things to Do Other Services -- Alterations & Cleaners -- Catering -- Education -- Banks -- Business/Marketing Consultants -- Developer -- Financial -- General Contractors -- Home Care -- Housing Authority -- Interior Design -- Legal -- Marketing Agencies -- Matting and Framing -- Pharmacy -- Photography -- Place to Live -- Postal Services -- Realtors -- Sports Agency -- Travel Agent Parks and Nature Dine -- Bars -- Candy, Bakery, Coffee, Ice Cream -- Juice Bars -- Restaurants SHOP -- Arts, Crafts & Framing -- Beauty & Wellness Products -- Books and Music -- Clothing & Accessories -- Consignment -- Convenience Store -- Florist -- Furniture, Home & Garden -- Jewelry -- Markets -- Office Supply & Greeting Cards -- Pets & Grooming -- Shoes -- Specialty -- Wine, Liquors & Cigars Weddings and Celebrations Parking Locations Beachside Pineapple Grove Arts District SOFA (South of Atlantic) The Ave The Set (West Atlantic) US1 Search CANCELLED: Art & Jazz on the Avenue East Atlantic Avenue: Swinton to NE 5th Avenue, Delray Beach, FL 33444 561-243-1077 Email Events Description (CANCELLED: TO BE RESCHEDULED) Art & Jazz on the Avenue is our signature outdoor street event in Downtown Delray with live music, live mural art, kids activities and dancing and dining in the street. Art & Jazz occurs several times throughout the year. It embodies the energy and vibe of our Village by the Sea! DATE: Wednesday, September 10, 2025 TO BE RESCHEDULED TIME: 6:00pm - 9:30pm WHERE: East Atlantic Avenue (From Swinton to NE 5th Avenue) Due to the severe weather this week and Wednesday's forecast, we’ve made the tough but right call to cancel Art & Jazz. Don’t worry...stay tuned, because we’ll be rescheduling the biggest Art & Jazz event of the year! Downtown Delray Beach’s East Atlantic Avenue , stretching from Swinton Avenue to NE 5th Avenue, is the heart of the city’s vibrant social and cultural scene. This lively corridor blends coastal charm with cosmopolitan energy, offering a walkable mix of local boutiques, stylish salons, lively restaurants, and buzzing cafés. Stroll beneath swaying palms and discover everything from artisan coffee shops and fashion-forward retailers to curated art galleries and wine bars. The area is home to beloved dining destinations like City Oyster , Rocco’s Tacos , The Office , Elisabetta’s , Caffe Luna Rosa , and Dada , known for its whimsical setting and creative menu. You’ll also find popular sweet spots like Gelato & Co. and Sloan’s Ice Cream . East Atlantic Avenue is also a hub for events and nightlife, with live music venues, cocktail lounges, and a festive atmosphere that carries from day to night. With proximity to the beach and the iconic Colony Hotel , Downtown Delray offers an ideal mix of relaxation, entertainment, and coastal flair—all in one walkable district. LIVE MUSIC, MURAL ARTISTS, SHOP AND EAT LOCAL WITH VENDORS: STAGE 1 - SE 2 nd Ave 5:30 – 7:00 – The Kittens (Jazz) 7:00 – 9:30 – Joe Freer Band (Jazz) STAGE 2 – SE 4 th Ave 5:30 – 7:00 – Signal Duo (Jazz) 7:00 – 9:30 – FM Band (Party Band) Other Live Performances taking place in Downtown: LOCATION 1 – Inside Tin Roof 7:00 – 9:30 – Krush Company (Motown/ Funk/ Top 40 Party Band) LOCATION 2 – NE 1 st Ave 5:30 – 7:00 – Delray Drum Circle LOCATION 3 – Inside Johnnie Browns 6:00 – 9:30 – The Flyers (Rock Band) MURAL ARTISTS - Golden 305 - IG: Golden305 Mars - IG: Sick_qirl The Delray Beach Downtown Development Authority created Art & Jazz on the Avenue in the 1990's to bring people to Downtown Delray and showcase our unique, local businesses. We produce Art & Jazz several times a year in four different Downtown Delray neighborhoods: Pineapple Grove, East Atlantic Avenue and Beachside. PARKING : www.downtowndelraybeach.com/parking WANT TO BE A VENDOR? SIGN UP HERE We are specifically looking for artists and crafters to be vendors! Do you create handcrafted or hand painted art or other items? Then we would love to have you as a vendor at Art & Jazz on the Avenue! Cost is $125 - included in that price is the vendor fee, one 10 x 10 tent, one table, two chairs and a light! Contact Danielle Morien at dmorien@downtowndelraybeach.com with any vendor questions. Thank you to our DDA Partners: Interested in becoming a sponsor?  Contact us, dda@downtowndelraybeach.com When Wednesday, September 10, 2025 6:00pm - 9:30pm Contact Info East Atlantic Avenue Swinton to NE 5th Avenue Delray Beach , FL 33444 dda@downtowndelraybeach.com 561-243-1077 Photos Sign Up for DDA Updates First Name Last Name Email* Please verify your request* Submit Media Video Gallery Careers About Us Our mission is to grow, strengthen, and enhance the economic vitality of Downtown Delray Beach. As an autonomous agency of the City, the Delray Beach DDA advocates, facilitates, plans, and executes business development, fosters business relations, helps with the planning of public and private projects, and markets the downtown district. Contact Information 350 SE 1st Street ∙ Delray Beach, FL 33483 (561) 243-1077 Copyright © 2025 Downtown Delray Beach. All rights reserved. Privacy Policy Business Login Powered by VUP Media

The International Latin Jazz & Arts Festival / Saturday, October 5, 2024 Presented by STARLITE ORGANIZATION FOR THE ARTS at  Unknown Oct 05 2024 The International Latin Jazz & Arts Festival We invite you to experience the SOUNDS, TASTE, ART and CULTURE of “All Things Latin” at San Antonio’s newest Hispanic Heritage celebration, THE INTERNATIONAL LATIN JAZZ & ARTS FESTIVAL. GET TICKETS ADMISSION IS FREE - DOORS OPEN AT 12 NOON Children's Music Symposium - Registration begins at 12 Noon "Salsa For Seniors" Dance Workshop - Registration begins at 12 Noon Award Winning Bradley Middle School Jazz Band | Ramon Alarcon y Tampico Jazz | SOFTA / SHP Bomba Worksho p  | Powerhouse Latino Big Band | Bomba Dance Performance |  Grammy Award Winning Flutist, NESTOR TORRES |  4 Time Grammy Award Winner THE SPANISH HARLEM ORCHESTRA Experience a variety of Latin Cuisine. Our food ... view more » ADMISSION IS FREE – DOORS OPEN AT 12 NOON Children’s Music Symposium – Registration begins at 12 Noon “Salsa For Seniors” Dance Workshop – Registration begins at 12 Noon Award Winning Bradley Middle School Jazz Band | Ramon Alarcon y Tampico Jazz | SOFTA / SHP Bomba Worksho p  | Powerhouse Latino Big Band | Bomba Dance Performance |  Grammy Award Winning Flutist, NESTOR TORRES |  4 Time Grammy Award Winner THE SPANISH HARLEM ORCHESTRA Experience a variety of Latin Cuisine. Our food vendors offer a range of mouth-watering options that will satisfy any foodie’s cravings. For those 21 and Over , there will be various companies offering Tastings of Spirits & Wine at La Esquina Alegre . Beer, Wine and mixed beverages will be available for purchase . Immerse yourself in the art that will be scattered throughout the festival grounds. Support local, statewide & national artists showcasing their work and talent. We’re committed to providing a safe and enjoyable experience for all of our attendees. From our rigorous security measures to our comprehensive health and safety protocols, we take every step necessary to ensure that everyone who attends the International Latin Jazz & Arts Festival can focus on enjoying the music and having a great time.  All Bags Will Be Subject To Checking By Security. https://youtube.com/shorts/5WYpWbBkRJY?si=a2VppPBIl8QBNrqJ All Proceeds benefit the Starlite Organization for the Arts. Adopt-a-Tree Program | Casselberry, FL - Official Site Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In Search Government Services Community Business How Do I Home Government Departments Public Works Green Up Casselberry Program Adopt-a-Tree Program Adopt-a-Tree Program Want a free tree in your yard? The City of Casselberry has a program to provide free Florida native trees for residents! Click here to apply for a tree. Applications for the 2025 cycle are due by August 31, 2025. To view trees offered under this program and their approximate sizes at planting, click here . Caring for your Florida-Friendly Tree Right tree/Right place :  Select a location considering mature size, as well as light and water needs. City staff can assist in confirming right tree/right place for your property. Yard Disturbance :  Keep in mind when the tree is planted, the hole may be three times the width of the container or root ball for the tree. Also, the top of the container soil/root crown of the tree will sit even with or slightly above the surrounding ground level. Soil : Once tree is planted, DO NOT add soil to the base of the tree or cover the root crown. Mulching : A common mistake in tree care is piling mulch over the root crown/base of the tree. Add mulch (e.g., pine straw) to the disturbed area instead. Watering New Tree : Water the planting area immediately after planting and at least daily for the first two weeks, then every other day for 3 months. After 3 months, weekly watering of 6-9 gallons per inch of trunk diameter until established (approximately 1 year from planting) and during dry periods is recommended. Watering After Establishing : Some trees are more drought resistant than others. Once the tree is established, water according to its individual needs (see specific information on individual species at www.casselberry.org/greenup or ask City Public Works staff for more information). Pruning : Do not over-prune your tree. The intent of this Adopt-A-Tree program is provide more tree canopy in the City, especially that can be enjoyed by the public (e.g., walking on a sidewalk). A common mistake is completely cutting back trees (such as crape myrtles) annually. This is unnecessary and may harm certain trees. General guidelines for proper pruning practices can be found at https://www.arborday.org/trees/tips/keys-to-pruning.cfm Pest/disease problems : Trees that tend to have a lower disease potential were purposely chosen for this program. However, if a disease or pest issue is suspected, contact Seminole County Extension volunteers for assistance Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m. - Noon and 1:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m. at (407) 665-5550 or via email. Contact Us: Public Works Department (407) 262-7725, Ext. 1235 email Physical Address Public Works Department 95 Triplet Lake Drive Casselberry, FL 32707 Hours Monday - Thursday 7:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m. Note some of these trees provided by the City of Casselberry are deciduous and will lose all of their leaves in the late fall or winter. Even for evergreen trees, they will shed leaves over time, providing opportunities to reuse leaves as mulch . Visit www.casselberry.org/greenup or www.ffl.ifas.ufl.edu for more information on Florida-friendly landscaping and related topics. Latin Jazz & Art Festival Presented by City of Casselberry at Lake Concord Park- City of Casselberry , Casselberry FL Sep 21 2024 Arturo Sandoval headlines the Latin Jazz and Art Festival. Art and Music! Ten Time Grammy Winning Latin Jazz Star Arturo Sandoval is Coming to Casselberry! Jazz trumpet sensation Arturo Sandoval returns to Casselberry on Sept. 21, 2024 to perform at the free Latin Jazz & Art Festival at Lake Concord Park located at 95 Triplet Lake Drive in Casselberry. Sponsored by the City of Casselberry and WUCF, this concert event from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. will entice all jazz lovers to come and enjoy a spectacular evening highlighted by the award-winning trumpeter, who previously appeared here in 2017. Sandoval began playing trumpet with street musicians as a 12-year-old boy in Cuba. In 1989, after touring with his friend and mentor, Dizzy Gillespie, Sandoval was invited by Gillespie to be a part of the United Nations Orchestra. During a tour with this group, Sandoval visited the American Embassy in Rome to defect from Cuba. He became an American citizen on December 7, 1998, and was presented with the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2013. Sandoval’s song “A Mis Abuelos” received Grammy Award nominations for Best Instrumental Composition and Best Arrangement. This composition was featured on his Grammy-winning album, Danzon . Other highlights from Sandoval’s discography featuring his compositions include Dear Diz (Every Day I Think of You) , Live at the Blue Note , Rumba Palace (Grammy 2007), and Hot House (Grammy 1998) His life was the subject of the film For Love or Country: The Arturo Sandoval Story , starring Andy García. Sandoval has won 10 Grammy Awards and been nominated 19 times; he has also received six Billboard Awards and one Emmy Award. Prior to the concert, some of the area’s greatest Latin visual artists will showcase their works in the Artista Siempre art exhibit. Everything from paintings and sculptures to mixed media masterpieces will be on display in Casselberry City Hall, Art House, Art Center and Sculpture House from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. This exciting exhibit kicks off the Latin Jazz & Art Festival celebrating Hispanic Heritage Month. Parking will be available at area businesses. For more information, call 407-262-7700 ext. 1507 or visit the website www.casselberry.org . ADMISSION INFO Phone: 407.262.7700 Email: events@casselberry.org Website: https://www.casselberry.org LOCATION Lake Concord Park- City of Casselberry 127 Quail Pond Circle, Casselberry, FL 32707 View in Google Maps Accessibility Information: Currently, no accessibility information is available for this event. Code Compliance | Casselberry, FL - Official Site Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In Search Government Services Community Business How Do I Home Government Departments Community Development Code Compliance Code Compliance Casselberry Code Compliance Portal File a Complaint Effective July 1, 2021, changes to Florida Statutes through Senate Bill 60 prohibit cities from initiating inspections of potential code violations by way of anonymous complaints. A person who reports a potential violation of a code or ordinance must provide their name and address before an investigation occurs. Any information provided to the City is subject to Florida's Public Records laws and as such, will be provided upon request. Code Compliance Mission The mission of Code Compliance is to promote and maintain a safe and desirable living and working environment. Code Compliance helps to maintain and improve the quality of the community by administering a fair and unbiased compliance program to correct violations of municipal codes and land use requirements. Code Compliance Officers work with residents, neighborhood associations, public services agencies, and other City departments to facilitate voluntary compliance with City laws and codes. Make Casselberry a better place to Live, Learn, Work, and Play To report a code violation, use the Code Compliance Portal or call the Casselberry Code Compliance Division at (407) 262-7766. All information provided is subject to Florida Public Records law. Receive a Code Violation? Find out how to correct the problem and do so promptly by contacting a Code Compliance Officer. In some cases, additional time can be provided based on the circumstances and progress towards correcting the violation. If prompt action is not taken, legal action may become necessary and the property owner may receive a notice to appear before the City's Special Magistrate. The Special Magistrate may impose fines up to $250 a day until compliance. Lien Reduction Please email the Code Compliance Coordinator , or call (407) 262-7700 Ext. 1104 to request a lien reduction. If you would like to rent the Jazz & Heritage Center for an event, please complete our Venue Request Form. We also use third-party cookies that help us analyze and understand how you use this website. These cookies will be stored in your browser only with your consent. You also have the option to opt-out of these cookies. But opting out of some of these cookies may affect your browsing experience. Functional Functional Functional cookies help to perform certain functionalities like sharing the content of the website on social media platforms, collect feedbacks, and other third-party features. Performance Performance Performance cookies are used to understand and analyze the key performance indexes of the website which helps in delivering a better user experience for the visitors. Analytics Analytics Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics the number of visitors, bounce rate, traffic source, etc. Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement cookies are used to provide visitors with relevant ads and marketing campaigns. These cookies track visitors across websites and collect information to provide customized ads. Class Got Brass Gallery Exhibits Events Get Involved Donations Jazz & Heritage Circle Sponsorship Opportunities Volunteer & Internship Opportunities Career Opportunities Donate Menu About Us The Foundation was set up in 1970 as the nonprofit owner of the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival presented by Shell – Jazz Fest – with a mission to sow the seeds of our unique culture for generations to come. In the five decades that followed, the Foundation has become a lighthouse of education, community support, and cultural preservation. Supported by grants, donations, and our events, we continue to teach, build, and celebrate Louisiana’s rich culture and community. Seven Arts 31A Harrogate Rd, Chapel Allerton, Leeds LS7 3PD Seven Arts, our main venue has an excellent performance space with good acoustics and a Yamaha piano donated by Besbrode Pianos plus welcoming cafe/bar. We run jazz concerts in the Venue on Thursday evenings and Sunday afternoons as well as Rush Hour Jazz gigs in the Seven Arts bar on Wednesdays. Contact: info@sevenleeds.co.uk Tel: 0113 262 6777 Northlight Arts 31 Potternewton Lane, Leeds LS7 3LW Northlight Arts is our workshop venue. We run our workshops on Sunday mornings, the Instant World orchestra rehearse there and we run occasional concerts there too- JazzLeeds have a Yamaha U1 piano based at the centre. Northlight Arts is a social enterprise, that give all profits to local community projects.
